mods.note: K-Kltf/6/ 'L.w BRITISH CONSULATE MUSCAT PILE NO: 8/62 NAME OF PILE: MUSCAT STATE AFFAIRS: PRINCIPAL SHAIKHS & TRIBES OF OMAN \ \ \- (5) Principal Sheikhs and Tribes of Oman,Ho. , of 1927. Political Agency and Consulate, Muscat. The 8th June 1927. Proa Major G. P. Murphy, I.A., Political Agent and K.B.M’o Consul, Muscat. To Sir, The Hon'hle Lieut-Colonel L.B.H.Haworth, I.A., Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire. i I hare the honour to forward herewith for reference in your Office a list which I have obtained showing the names oi the present Sheikhs of the principal tribes of Oman. I have the honour to be. Sir, Your most obedient servant. Major, Political Agent and li.i5.M*s Consul, Muscat.—

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 8/62 MUSCAT STATE AFFAIRS: PRINCIPAL SHAIKHS & TRIBES OF OMAN'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 25; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 3-24; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: This file consists of a list, sent by the Political Agent and Consul at Muscat to the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, showing the names of the current shaikhs of the principal tribes of Oman. The list, which contains the names of around seventy individuals, is followed by an extensive index of tribes and sub-tribes in Oman. The page references in the index refer to John Gordon Lorimer's Gazetteer of the Persian Gulf, Oman and Central Arabia.
